profile: Experienced in Visual Basic, Java, PHP, HTML, Python, WordPress, and various other programming languages and environments
Experienced in the use of Photoshop for fine-grained adjustment of images for use in research

Currently taking a course in web design and digital marketing, reinforcing and providing a formal foundation in web development (PHP, HTML, JS, WordPress) and digital design (Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign)
Masters of Science in Psychology (Cognition & Brain Science), a testament to my ability to commit to high intensity, long term projects

Familiar and comfortable with managing tremendous workloads with conflicting requirements and under strict deadlines, all while generating high quality deliverables – an inevitable result of graduate studies in a competitive field

items.label: Javascript
items.text: I am a skilled React developer, having developed several React apps over the past two years as part of my work at CityAutobahn. Almost all of these have communication with a server written in a different language at their core; this site is also built in React, backed by an Express server. I'm also familiar with using JS outside React, such as when I have written scripts in jQuery or the Express server that backs this site.

items.label: PHP
items.text: I have been using PHP as my primary development language for the past 4 years, since a large chunk of my work has been focused on Wordpress; I've also had the opportunity to do side projects outside of the Wordpress environment. I've also had the opportunity to leverage the Wordpress REST API to write many custom PHP endpoints for interfacing with React apps on the same website and Android apps on mobile devices

items.label: Mobile Development (React Native, Kotlin)
items.text: In the last year, I've had the opportunity to develop a couple of mobile apps for CityAutobahn. At the time of this writing, one has been distributed to beta users for evaluation, while the other is awaiting feedback from the marketing team for design updates. The one for beta users was built for a dedicated Point-of-sale terminal running Android, and thus was written in Kotlin; the other is expected to have wider distribution and as such was written in React Native to allow building into both Android and iOS versions

items.label: C# (Unity)
items.text: I like to spend my weekends developing Unity games; I've taken part in one game jam and have developed a handful of tech demos and small games, which can found in the 'projects' section

items.label: Databases (SQL)
items.text: Any good website needs a database to provide content; as a Wordpress developer, I have plenty of experience in setting up a straightforward non-sharded relational database (typically MySQL, though I've had the opportunity to play around with PostGreSQL) and generating queries to perform all the operations required by a small-to-medium sized website or mobile app

items.label: Graphics (C++)
items.text: After a semester studying the basic concepts underlying Ray tracing (straight C++) and Real time rendering (C++ & HLSL), I found myself fascinated by the subject, and proceeded to go as far as I could manage using online resources to learn about graphics and rendering. I am no expert in this area, but I have repos showcasing my efforts as I worked through this fascinating area.

items.label: Design
items.text: While I'm not a designer by trade, I do have experience in working with client desires and expectations to come up with decent designs; I've used Figma and simple static HTML pages to layout and demo projects for clients to review and thus allow us to cooperatively come up with a good product design

items.label: Academic Development (Python, MATLAB, E-Prime, etc)
items.text: My time as a graduate student of Psychology gave me plenty of opportunities to undertake development for academic purposes. Specifically, I built and maintained several psychological studies conducted on human subjects, administered through a variety of means - E-Prime, MATLAB, and online (powered variously by PHP, Flash, and python). In the last case, I had the opportunity to integrate a site built with PHP and Flash with Amazon's mechanical turk crowd-sourcing platform.

items.label: Data Analysis
items.text: As a graduate student in Psychology, a big portion of my work consisted of statistical analyses and interpreting the results of said analyses. Consequently, I'm competent in the use of standard statistical tools, both Frequentist (for example, ANOVA or t-tests) and simple Bayesian analyses.

items.label: Data Presentation
items.text: A crucial part of any academic's career is understanding how to best present their data and analyses; this includes not only the actual verbal or written presentation, but also charts, tables, demonstrations, flowcharts, and any other means that can be used to communicate to a lay audience the meaning, significance, and implications of your findings. I have ample experience in doing exactly this.

items.label: Teaching and Presenting
items.text: I'm experienced in translating complex, intricate findings into easily understandable form for lay audiences, as a consequence of teaching experience and frequent conference presentations. I've also had the pleasure of guiding first year undergraduate students as they learned the fundamentals of their field, supplementing course material with personal experiences and direct exposure to field research. These skills are supported by my time in Toastmasters International, where I honed my presentation skills (and, to that end, received the "Competent Communication" award)

items.label: Facilitating communication
items.text: As a Teaching Assistant at University of Victoria, I served as a point of contact between students and instructor. Similarly, during my tenure teaching at Q College, I spent a good chunk of my time setting up my students for success by providing them the tools they need to working in development teams
